Description: Foot sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery Droop cup; stemmed foot with broad resting surface; exterior glazed black; stand-ring reserved; inside of cone glazed; glaze inscription of Nikosthenes on underside.
Curator's comments: Published and discussed in Tosto, V., The Black-Figured Pottery Signed ΝΙΚΟΣΘΕΝΕΣΕΠΟΙΕΣΕΝ. Amsterdam 1999,152-3, 231, no. 163, fig. 88.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.53)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0598) (Phase 1)
